title: 141414 all the way ...

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"14\upuparrows 14\quad means\quad { 14 }^{ { 14 }^{ { 14 }^{ 14{ . }^{ . } } } }."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"
Clearly, if we look at the occurrence pattern of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"14"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", we see that if the power of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"14"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is even, the unit's digit is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"6"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and if the power is odd, the unit's digit is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"From the question, the power of the first base "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"14"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", is clearly even. So, the unit's digit will definitely be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"6"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"14 \uparrow\uparrow 14 = 14^{14 \uparrow\uparrow 13}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The exponent is thus "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"14^a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is an integer greater than 1. Hence, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"14^a = 0 \mod 4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"14^{14^a} \mod 10 = 4^4 \mod 10 = \boxed{6}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            how did you come up with 16?

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Well, if you are familiar with the phi function, you should look for numbers whose totient is the power.For instance, the power here is 4, and phi of 16 is equal to four, so it works.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

title: Linear momentum vs angular momentum

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"It cannot be determined because We know Angular momentum is conserved means L= constant or "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{dL}{dt} = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So now , "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\tau_{ext} = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So no External torque is acting on it. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So it doesnt mean that No "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"F_{ext}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is acting on it, As "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\tau_{ext} = F_{ext} .r"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So If r=0 then also "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\tau_{ext} = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"And If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"F_{ext} = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" then also "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\tau_{ext} = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"And Linear momentum is conserved when "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"F_{ext} = 0 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So it may or may not be,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So we cannot determine it by this statement."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hence answer is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{\text{Cannot be determined}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            It is not necessary that linear momentum remains conserved simple think of an example of uniform circular motion linear momentum changes in dt time but angular momentum remains convered.
